etymology.description: 亼(亼) (jí, 'gather') + 兄(兄) (xiōng, 'elder brother') written twice -> people agreeing unanimously -> stylized as 亼 + 吅(吅) (xuān, 'gathering sounds') + 从(从) (cóng, 'follow')
etymology.interpretation: The character initially depicted multiple 兄(兄) (xiōng, 'elder brother') gathered under 亼(亼) (jí, 'gather'), representing a collective agreement or consensus. It evolved into a form combining 吅(吅) (xuān, 'gathering sounds') with 从(从) (cóng, 'follow'), symbolizing unity and collective action.
etymology.simplification: Simplified in Japanese as 㑒 by altering the composition but keeping a similar structure.
